meanings.definition: The quality or state of being trite.
meanings.sent1: The triteness of his jokes made everyone yawn.
meanings.sent2: Her writing was filled with triteness, lacking any new ideas.
meanings.sent3: Despite the triteness of the situation, she found humor in it.
meanings.sent4: The triteness of the plot was like a worn-out record playing on repeat.
meanings.sent5: The triteness of his excuses was as clear as day.

meanings.sent1: The triteness of the song made it sound like every other pop tune.
meanings.sent2: His artwork suffered from triteness, as it resembled famous paintings too closely.
meanings.sent3: The triteness of the costume party theme made her laugh at its predictability.
meanings.sent4: The triteness of his ideas was a roadblock to his creativity.
meanings.sent5: The triteness of the speech left the audience feeling uninspired.
